mdRecord.dcterms:title: Les provinces des Pays-Bas Catholiques ou A most exact map of Flanders or ye Austrian Netherlands &c: It comprehends all the towns, villages, abbeys, monasteries throughout all these provinces &c / By H. Moll, Geographer
Most exact map of Flanders or ye Austrian Netherlands &c
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bowles, John, 1701-1779
Bowles, Thomas, -1767
Fricx, Eugène-Henri, 1644-1730
King, John.
Moll, Herman, -1732
Ormonde, James Butler Duke of, 1665-1745
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Sold by H. Moll over against Devereux Court between Temple Bar and St. Clements Church in ye Strand. I. Bowles Print and Map seller at the Black Horse in Cornhill & T. Bowles Print and mapseller next to ye Chapter house in S. Pauls Ch. yard. And John King at the Globe in the Poultry.
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 61 x 100 cm. on sheet 64 x 106 cm. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Relief shown pictorially and by soundings.
Prime meridians: London and Ferro Island.
Text just to the right of the title cartouche describes terms of a "treaty for settling the barrier in the Netherlands" which was signed at Antwerp in November 1715.

Insets: Plan du toutes sortes d'ouvrages dont on se sert dans les fortifications... = A plan of all manner of works used in fortification... -- Carte des Grand Chemins de Paris a Valenciene = A map of the roads from Paris to Valenciene -- La partie meridionale de Luxembourgh est continuée icy = The south part of Luxembourgh is continued here.
Some notes are in French and English.
Note at lower center explains that this map is based on a survey of the Spanish Netherlands published at Brussels by Mr. Fricz.
Towns color coded to show French, Dutch and Flemish possessions.
Dedication: To His Grace Iames Duke of Ormond, Captain General of Her Majesty's Forces &c. This map is humbly dedicated by your Lordship's most humble servant Herman Moll Geogr.
An earlier issue of the map, ca. 1914, has only the Moll imprint.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: "Flanders" written in brown ink on verso.
